dhp383:3: Having known the elimination of all things,
dhp383:4: you will know the Unmade, brahmin.
dhp384:3: then all fetters come to an end
dhp385:1: One for whom the beyond, the not-beyond,
dhp385:2: and both beyond and not beyond cannot be found,
dhp385:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp386:2: the task complete, free of defilements,
dhp386:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp387:5: and the one that shines both day and night
dhp387:6: is the Buddha, the Radiant One.
dhp388:1: One who has expelled all evil is called a brahmin,
dhp388:2: one who lives peacefully is called a contemplative,
dhp388:3: one who has personally exiled all their contaminants
dhp389:1: A brahmin would not attack another person,
dhp389:2: nor would a brahmin abandon one.
dhp389:3: Woe comes to one who attacks a brahmin,
dhp389:4: woe comes to one who abandons a brahmin.
dhp390:1: There is nothing better than this for a brahmin:
dhp390:2: when the mind is kept away from its preferences.
dhp390:3: Whenever one turns away from causing harm,
dhp390:4: then suffering is replaced by peace.
dhp391:3: one who is restrained in these three ways -
dhp391:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp392:1: If someone has helped you understand the Dhamma
dhp392:2: taught by the fully awakened one,
dhp392:3: then you should respectfully venerate them,
dhp392:4: like a brahmin at a fire-sacrifice.
dhp393:1: It is not because of tangled hair, lineage,
dhp393:2: or birth that one is a brahmin.
dhp393:3: One in whom there is truth, Dhamma,
dhp394:1: Fool, what does tangled hair do for you?
dhp394:2: What does a goatskin robe do for you?
dhp394:3: Inside you there is a jungle;
dhp395:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp396:1: I do not say that one is a brahmin
dhp396:2: because of the womb they were born from or the mother that produced them;
dhp396:5: but one who is not possessive and not acquisitive -
dhp396:6: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp397:1: One who has cut all fetters
dhp397:3: who has transcended all bonds and is unattached -
dhp397:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp398:1: Having cut the thong and strap,
dhp398:2: having broken every link of the chain,
dhp398:3: one who has removed the barricade and is awakened -
dhp398:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp399:2: one who endures these without getting upset,
dhp399:3: with patience as strong as an army -
dhp399:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp400:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp401:1: Like water on a lotus leaf,
dhp401:2: like a mustard seed on a needle tip,
dhp401:3: one to whom sensuality does not stick -
dhp401:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp402:2: and has personally eliminated it here and now,
dhp402:3: who has set down the burden, unattached -
dhp402:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp403:1: One who has profound wisdom and intelligence,
dhp403:2: expert in what is and is not the path,
dhp403:3: who has attained the highest goal -
dhp403:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp404:3: a homeless wanderer with few wishes -
dhp404:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp405:1: One who has renounced violence towards living beings,
dhp405:3: who does not injure or kill -
dhp405:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp406:1: One who is unhindered amidst the hindered,
dhp406:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp407:2: conceit, and contempt have fallen away,
dhp407:3: like mustard seeds from a needle tip -
dhp407:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp408:1: One who speaks words that are gentle, instructive,
dhp408:3: and that do not create attachment to anything -
dhp408:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp409:1: One who steals nothing in the world -
dhp409:2: whether it is long or short, small or large,
dhp409:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp410:1: One in whom no longing can be found,
dhp410:2: for this world or the next,
dhp410:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp411:1: One in whom no adherence can be found,
dhp411:2: who has overcome confusion through direct knowledge,
dhp411:3: who has reached immersion in the deathless -
dhp411:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp412:2: attachment to both merit and evil,
dhp412:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp413:1: One who, like the moon, is stainless, pure,
dhp413:3: one who has completely eliminated delight in existence -
dhp413:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp414:3: a meditator who has transcended it, crossed over it, gone beyond it,
dhp414:6: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp415:3: who has completely eliminated sensual existence -
dhp415:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp416:3: who has completely eliminated craving for existence -
dhp416:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp416:7: who has completely eliminated craving for existence -
dhp416:8: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp417:1: One who is no longer attached to human existence,
dhp417:2: and is not attached to celestial existence either;
dhp417:3: one who is not attached to anything -
dhp417:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp418:3: a hero who has overcome the entire world -
dhp418:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp419:2: the death and rebirth of sentient beings,
dhp419:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp420:1: One whose destiny is not known
dhp420:2: by any angel, spirit, or human,
dhp420:3: an Arahant whose corruptions have been eliminated -
dhp420:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp421:1: One who has nothing before, after,
dhp421:3: one who is not possessive and not acquisitive -
dhp421:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp422:4: that is who I call a brahmin.
dhp423:1: One who knows their past lives,
dhp423:3: who has reached the elimination of birth,
dhp423:4: a sage who has mastery of higher knowledge,
dhp423:6: that is who I call a brahmin.
